org.springframework.security.samples.servletapi.mvc

类 ServletApiController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.security.samples.servletapi.mvc.ServletApiController

  • @Controller
public class ServletApiController
extends java.lang.Object
    A Spring MVC Controller that demonstrates Spring Security's integration with the standard Servlet API's. Specifically it demonstrates the following:
    • authenticate(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) - Integration with HttpServletRequest.authenticate(HttpServletResponse)
    • login(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse, LoginForm, BindingResult) - Integration with HttpServletRequest.login(String, String)
    • logout(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse, RedirectAttributes) - Integration with HttpServletRequest.logout()
    • remoteUser(HttpServletRequest) - Integration with HttpServletRequest.getRemoteUser()
    • userPrincipal(HttpServletRequest) - Integration with HttpServletRequest.getUserPrincipal()
    • authentication(Authentication) - Spring MVC's ability to resolve the Authentication since it is found on HttpServletRequest.getUserPrincipal()
    作者:
    Rob Winch

      • authenticate

        @RequestMapping(value="/authenticate")
public java.lang.String authenticate(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                                                                      throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                                                                             java.io.IOException
        Demonstrates that HttpServletRequest.authenticate(HttpServletResponse) will send the user to the log in page configured within Spring Security if the user is not already authenticated.

        request -

        返回:
        抛出:

      • login

        @RequestMapping(value="/login",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String login(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                                                                             @ModelAttribute
                                                                                             LoginForm loginForm,
                                                                                             org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result)
                                                                                      throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Demonstrates that you can authenticate with Spring Security using HttpServletRequest.login(String, String).

        If we fail to authenticate, a ServletException is thrown that wraps the original AuthenticationException from Spring Security. This means we can catch the ServletException to display the error message. Alternatively, we could allow the ServletException to propegate and Spring Security's ExceptionTranslationFilter would catch it and process it appropriately.

        In this method we choose to use Spring MVC's ModelAttribute to make things easier for our form. However, this is not necessary. We could have just as easily obtained the request parameters from the HttpServletRequest object. Remember all of these examples would work in a standard Servlet or anything with access to the HttpServletRequest and HttpServletResponse.

        参数:
        request -
        response -
        loginForm -
        result -
        返回:
        抛出:
        javax.servlet.ServletException

      • logout

        @RequestMapping(value="/logout")
public java.lang.String logout(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                 javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                                                 org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirect)
                                                          throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Demonstrates that invoking HttpServletRequest.logout() will log the user out. Note that the response does not get processed, so you need to write something to the response.
        参数:
        request -
        response -
        redirect -
        返回:
        抛出:
        javax.servlet.ServletException

      • asynch

        @RequestMapping(value="/async")
public void asynch(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Demonstrates Spring Security with AsyncContext.start(Runnable). Spring Security will automatically transfer the SecurityContext from the thread that AsyncContext.start(Runnable) is invoked to the new Thread that invokes the Runnable.
        参数:
        request -
        response -

      • authentication

        @ModelAttribute
public org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
        Spring MVC will automatically resolve any object that implements Principal using HttpServletRequest.getUserPrincipal(). This means you can easily resolve the Authentication just by adding it as an argument to your MVC controller. Alternatively, you could also have an argument of type Principal which would not couple your controller to Spring Security.
        参数:
        authentication -
        返回:
